title: Small modular nuclear reactors were tried in the 1950s and won’t be better today

last_post.content:
> Small modular reactors won’t achieve economies of manufacturing scale, won’t be faster to construct, forego efficiency of vertical scaling, won’t be cheaper, aren’t suitable for remote or brownfield coal sites, still face very large security costs, will still be costly and slow to decommission, and still require liability insurance caps. They don’t solve any of the problems that they purport to while intentionally choosing to be less efficient

title: T-Mobile's latest customer data breach wasn't a "hack"

last_post.content:
There's one big detail about T-Mobile's latest security incident that everyone in the media is getting wrong:

The company wasn't hacked. Someone exploited T-Mobile's API and collected data on millions of customers that the company freely gave away.

People should be asking why they did this, but we won't get there if the company is seen as a victim of a "hack" that wasn't. https://thedesk.net/2023/01/t-mobile-compromise-api-was-not-hacked/

title: Woods | Escape From Tarkov Interactive Map | Map Genie

last_post.content:
Map knowledge is hugely important, and the game does you no favors. You spawn in with no map, no compass. So you load up https://mapgenie.io/tarkov/maps/woods on your second screen.

You move around a bit, and try to establish where you might be on the map. You check which extract points are open, and plot a course.

This gets a lot easier as you run the map more, but at first is completely overwhelming. I've spent entire raids not sure where I am, just running away from the sounds of distant gunfire.

title: Point of View: The biospheric emergency calls for scientists to change tactics

last_post.content:
This is *not* the way scientific papers typically begin:
_________________________

We are running out of time. Ecosystems across the planet are being destroyed at an accelerating rate. The life sciences – once a field dedicated to the study of living systems and our interactions with them – are increasingly becoming sciences of the dead. Up to one million species are currently threatened with extinction, many of them within decades.
_________________________

It's a very good sign, however, an indication that at least some scientists are now ready to speak boldly and unequivocally about the greatest emergency our species has ever faced.

SEE THE FULL PAPER -- https://elifesciences.org/articles/83292

#ClimateEmergency #BiodiversityLoss #Extinction

last_post.content:
But giving control over our production to a single company doesn't just deprive us of the choice to take our business elsewhere. It's an invitation to dominant firms to squeeze all the #slack out of their supply chains, stripping out all the safety margins, selling off plant and leasing it back, relocating to distant, low-tax jurisdictions.

Because not all inflation is caused by price-gouging. Some is caused by too little #capacity:

title: 'Passages' Review: A Sensual, Euro Love Triangle from Ira Sachs

last_post.content: The Playlist: ‘Passages’ Review: Franz Rogowski, Adèle Exarchopoulos & Ben Whishaw Star In Ira Sachs’ Irresistible Love Triangle [Sundance] https://theplaylist.net/passages-review-sundance-20230123/

You may think that Cal-Maine is only one of many egg companies, but that's only because it's a many-tentacled octopus of a company, having rolled up dozens of other companies, including "Farmhouse Eggs, Sunups, Sunny Meadow, Egg-Land’s Best and Land O’ Lakes eggs."

The egg-aisle at your supermarket is just another #DuffBrewery, where all the different vats are being fed with the same sludge out of a common pipe:

https://simpsons.fandom.com/wiki/Duff_Tour_Guide

9/

title: Pluralistic: 02 Feb 2022 – Pluralistic: Daily links from Cory Doctorow

last_post.content:
All of this militates for price-gouging as the factor driving record egg prices, with bird flu standing in for inflation as a handy smokescreen. But even if we stipulate that Cal-Maine has cut its margins to the bone to help out the American egg-eater amid an avian superflu, that's no reason to CALM down.

Supply-chain shocks are endemic to concentrated markets. When we put all our eggs in one basket then even minor disruptions can have huge effects.

https://pluralistic.net/2022/02/02/its-the-economy-stupid/#overinflated

I'll pick it back up again with (9):

(9) Organization tolerance to ambiguity, uncertainty and flux affects the possibility of using more productive techniques. The most productive techniques rely on parallel development, with embedded ambiguity, uncertainty and flux. However, not all people or organizations can tolerate high levels of those. To the extent they cannot handle them, they cannot use those techniques. This presents an upper limit to an organization’s productivity.

Here's my review of @driscoll`s THE MODEM WORLD - the book explores little-known aspects from the (pre)history of social media, c. 1978-1995. The book's call to imagine a post-commercial online world hits the nerve of our time!

Can't recommend this book enough (go buy & read it)! I especially hope that the book will encourage scholars outside the US to explore the history of their local BBSs (that's still a niche).

https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/full/10.1177/14614448221151051

We typically use a 5% alpha level. The line in claim making needs to be drawn somewhere. But in this paper https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/pdf/10.1177/25152459221080396 we discuss some scenarios where you might justify using a different alpha level. Balancing error rates is sensible if you want to use data to decide how to continue in a research line, and resources are limited. With large N, it leads to more impressive claims. And in applied research alpha might be set based on a cost benefit analysis.

title: Access is not the same as accessibility: A framework for making research papers truly open – arXiv.org blog

last_post.content:
Very glad to see the #arxiv steps toward #accessibility (#a11y). These include "offering well-formatted #HTML, alongside #PDF and #TeX source."
https://blog.arxiv.org/2023/01/19/access-is-not-the-same-as-accessibility-a-framework-for-making-research-papers-truly-open/

PS: There are 𝘮𝘢𝘯𝘺 reasons to offer well-formatted HTML alongside PDF, or to stop publishing PDF-only. Accessibility is first, followed closely by making work friendly to mobile users, users with low bandwidth, and users who need to text-mine, cut/paste, or use machine translation.

True the Vote, a group that spread discredited election conspiracy theories, “abandoned” The Freedom Hospital in April 2022, according to its lawyers. Yet board member Gregg Phillips continued to seek donations for the project for months afterward.

https://www.propublica.org/article/ukraine-freedom-hospital-true-the-vote-phillips-engelbrecht

I really like this paper: Talking About Large Language Models, by Murray Shanahan

https://www.arxiv-vanity.com/papers/2212.03551/

> A bare-bones LLM doesn’t “really” know anything because all it does, at a fundamental level, is sequence prediction. Sometimes a predicted sequence takes the form of a proposition. But the special relationship propositional sequences have to truth is apparent only to the humans who are asking questions, or to those who provided the data the model was trained on.

India has banned a BBC documentary critical of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s alleged role in deadly riots more than 20 years ago from being shown in the country. Now kornia-rs pip-installable for M1-Macs, for python 3.8, 3.9

kornia-rs is an experimental library to provide I/O functionality for images (future: video, cameras), and visualisation in future, written in Rust.

pip install kornia-rs

https://github.com/kornia/kornia-rs

title: Exclusive: OpenAI Used Kenyan Workers on Less Than $2 Per Hour to Make ChatGPT Less Toxic

last_post.content:
People realise that:
- Training an AI model require workforce to label and classify stuff. It's not comes out of nowhere like magic.
- That work likely be subcontracted and not realized by tech startup itself.
- Sub-contractors will make it down in poor country because it's more affordable & profitable
- They will STILL pay MORE than the minimum wage, and include psychological support, which cost also less in those countries.
- It's the same with content moderation

https://time.com/6247678/openai-chatgpt-kenya-workers/

title: De diversiteit-innovatie paradox in de wetenschap - StukRoodVlees

last_post.content:
RT @NL_Wetenschap@twitter.com

Van zomer 2017 tot zomer 2020 woonde ik & mijn vrouw in California & was ik postdoctoraal onderzoeker aan Stanford University @Stanford@twitter.com. Daar schreef ik o.a. het wetenschappelijke paper dat ik in onderstaand stuk samenvat: https://stukroodvlees.nl/de-diversiteit-innovatie-paradox-in-de-wetenschap/. (Ik zal op dat paper terugkomen)

🐦🔗: https://twitter.com/NL_Wetenschap/status/1617448343499862017

Here's the pre-print. Many thanks to all who helped make the paper better along the way. (Hang in there, job market candidates twiddling thumbs in the review process.) I am tinkering with follow-up ideas but time is scarce. DM me if you want to team up or have thoughts on what needs work. Thanks for reading & stay tuned! https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=3581796
